title: Bulldogs' reign over Vols continues with OT win

His fans form legions ready to take up the cudgels for him, quite belligerently at that, at the mere sign of criticism ‚Äî either of his movies or of the actor himself. It is this hood that he hopes will stand by him as he quits a successful career at its peak to enter politics and help him become a hero in this arena too. title: 'Unite the Kingdom': Massive anti-immigration protests rock London; cops 'assaulted with kicks, punches'
content: London witnessed a massive "Unite the Kingdom" rally led by far-right activist Tommy Robinson, drawing over 100,000 participants expressing anti-migrant sentiments. The march, framed as a free speech event, featured speakers promoting racist conspiracy theories, sparking clashes with police and a counter-protest.

title: ‚ÄòDoppelganger did it‚Äô: Group chat shows suspect‚Äôs demeanor after Kirk killing
content: Following the fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Tyler Robinson initially joked about his resemblance to the suspect in an online group chat. He quipped about a "doppelganger" trying to implicate him, even as the FBI sought the public's help in identifying the individual captured in surveillance images.

title: 'Completely safe': Nepal urges tourists to return; claims nation slowly recovering
content: Following recent protests, Nepali citizens are using social media to reassure tourists that the country is safe. The Nepal Tourism Board is offering free visa renewals for those affected by the demonstrations. Despite initial concerns, tourists like Luke Ziccardi are proceeding with their travel plans, including treks to Everest base camp.

title: Asia Cup: Tension rises; India‚Äôs dressing room on edge before Pak clash
content: On the eve of India's Asia Cup clash with Pakistan, India‚Äôs assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate, who hails from the Netherlands, discovered how India vs Pakistan begins long before the first ball, and why cricket is never just about cricket.

title: 'My brain is worth Rs 200 crore': Nitin Gadkari amid ethanol row
content: Amidst criticism surrounding the ethanol program, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari asserted his integrity and financial independence, stating his work is driven by a desire to improve farmers' lives, particularly in Vidarbha, where farmer suicides are a concern.

title: Nano Banana trend: Turn photos into 3D figurines with Google AI Studio; 15 easy prompts
content: Google's new AI image editor, "Nano Banana," integrated into the Gemini app, allows users to effortlessly transform photos into 3D models. This tool, officially known as Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has seen widespread adoption, with over 200 million images created or modified. Users can easily generate 3D figurines, designer pet toys, and fantasy avatars using simple text prompts.

title: Boxing: Historic night! Jaismine crowned world champ, Nupur takes silver
content: Jaismine Lamboria clinched a historic gold for India in the women's 57kg category at the World Boxing Championships 2025, held in Liverpool, defeating Poland's Julia Szeremeta. Nupur added to India's success with a silver in the +80kg division. Pooja Rani secured a bronze, marking India's best-ever performance with three finalists.

title: Asia Cup: Calm before storm! Will India vs Pak live up to its 'historical' hype?
content: India-Pakistan clashes are never for the faint-hearted. Every duel on the field is a battle within a battle, but on paper it looks like one-way traffic, with India clearly going in as favourites. Will Salman Ali Agha-led cricket's perpetual "cornered" tigers turn the tables around? Brace yourself for another epic spectacle at the Dubai International Stadium on Sunday.

title: Charlie Kirk‚Äôs killing: Musk questions Microsoft over staff's remarks; company responds
content: Elon Musk has called out Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella over alleged posts by Activision Blizzard employees celebrating Charlie Kirk's assassination. Screenshots of these posts circulated on X, prompting Musk to question Nadella directly. Microsoft responded, stating they are reviewing the situation and condemning any comments celebrating violence, emphasizing that such views do not align with the company's values.

title: Charlie Kirk murder: FBI says Tyler Robinson's transgender partner 'had no idea'
content: Tyler Robinson, accused of assassinating Charlie Kirk, had a partner who is fully cooperating with the FBI investigation. Officials confirm the partner, described as a male transitioning to female, was unaware of Robinson's alleged plan. Text messages and digital evidence seized from their shared apartment are being analyzed, as the FBI investigates all connections to the case.

title: The Bengal Files collection day 9: Film witnesses growth; comes very close to Rs 13cr mark
content: Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Bengal Files,' featuring Mithun Chakraborty and Anupam Kher, witnessed growth during its second weekend, adding over a crore to its earnings. After a 9-day theatrical run, the political drama's net collection nears Rs 13 crore. Despite facing competition, the film picked up pace on its second Saturday, showing positive momentum.

title: Did Irfan take a dig at Pakistan? Here‚Äôs what happened ahead of Ind vs Pak clash
content: Irfan Pathan's cryptic social media post, praising Sri Lanka as the Asia Cup's second-best team, has ignited a pre-match buzz ahead of the highly anticipated India vs Pakistan clash. This subtle jab appears to counter Pakistan captain Salman Ali Agha's earlier reaction to suggestions of Afghanistan's strength.

title: 'Left no choice': Amazon suspends engineer; sent 'threatening' letter to CEO
content: Amazon has suspended a Palestinian software engineer for criticizing its business ties with Israel, specifically the Project Nimbus cloud computing contract. Ahmed Shahrour's internal communications expressing opposition led to his suspension and an ongoing investigation. He alleges the company suppresses pro-Palestinian voices, a claim Amazon denies, while similar protests have resulted in terminations at Microsoft and Google.

title: Manipur visit: PM Modi calls state 'jewel in India's crown'; seeks peace between hills, valley
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Manipur, appealing for harmony amidst ethnic strife. He unveiled ‚Çπ8,500 crore in projects to rebuild infrastructure and restore hope, emphasizing reconciliation and development. Modi met displaced families, reaffirming the government's commitment to peace.

title: Anti-terror techs set to be Quad priority
content: Despite summit uncertainties, Quad nations are actively pursuing counterterrorism efforts, including workshops addressing drone misuse and the exploitation of emerging technologies by terrorists. India acknowledges US commitment to the Quad, even amidst evolving US-China relations. The group will also launch its Ports of the Future Partnership, highlighting ongoing cooperation in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Fatty liver: Could simple vitamin reverse world‚Äôs most common liver disease?
content: Fatty liver disease, a growing global health concern, may have a new, inexpensive treatment option. A recent study identified vitamin B3 (niacin) as a potential agent to reduce liver fat accumulation and improve insulin sensitivity by targeting a key molecule, miR-93.

title: 10 Kuki-Zo MLAs submit memorandum to Modi on UT demand
content: During Prime Minister Modi's visit to Manipur, ten Kuki-Zo MLAs, including seven from the BJP, submitted a memorandum urging the Centre to expedite dialogue for a separate Union Territory with a legislature. Citing ethnic cleansing and displacement, they asserted that separation is necessary for peace and security. The Kuki-Zo Council echoed this demand, emphasizing it as a necessity for survival.

title: Charlie Kirk assassination: Why is FBI director Kash Patel under fire?
content: President Trump defended FBI Director Kash Patel amidst scrutiny over the Charlie Kirk assassination investigation. Patel faced criticism for his handling of updates and past controversies, but the White House strongly supports his work. A suspect, Tyler Robinson, is in custody, and Patel is set to appear before Congress to address concerns about the investigation.

title: Hull vs Injury: Painful ankle update shocks fans ‚Äî Queen City setback
content: Charley Hull revealed at the Kroger Queen City Championship that she tore a ligament in her ankle after a fall. Despite the injury, she's impressively tied for second place, just two shots behind the leader. Hull's strong performance comes amidst a busy schedule, including recent high finishes at the AIG Women‚Äôs Open and the Aramco Houston Championship.

title: Allen vs Jets: Bills QB injury in spotlight ‚Äî latest update ahead
content: Josh Allen is set to lead the Buffalo Bills against the New York Jets in a crucial AFC East showdown, despite no official injury update. Allen remains focused after their Week 1 comeback victory. The Bills must address their run defense against Justin Fields and the Jets, who are coming off a narrow loss.

title: Will Joe Burrow play against the Jacksonville Jaguars tomorrow?
content: Cincinnati Bengals' quarterback Joe Burrow is set to play against the Jacksonville Jaguars at Paycor Stadium. After a victorious season opener against the Cleveland Browns, Burrow expressed his readiness to be more aggressive and adaptable on the field. Despite some Bengals players listed with injuries, Burrow is reported to be fully fit and focused on securing another win.

title: Ensure dignified living in beggar homes: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has directed states and UTs to improve living conditions in beggar homes, ensuring dignified shelter, regular health check-ups, and nutritious food. The court also mandated vocational training for self-reliance and emphasized safety and childcare for women inmates. The Centre has been tasked with framing model guidelines for uniform implementation within three months.

title: Richardson vs Jackson: 100m heat thriller at World Championships
content: Sha'Carri Richardson edged out Shericka Jackson in a thrilling 100m heat at the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo, clocking 11.03 seconds. Jackson finished a close second at 11.04 seconds. Australia's Torrie Lewis secured third place with 11.08 seconds, setting a new national record. This victory fuels Richardson's confidence as she prepares for the semi-finals, continuing her rivalry with Jackson.

title: SC dismisses NUJS's sexual harassment complaint; orders VC to mention judgment in resume
content: The Supreme Court dismissed a sexual harassment complaint against the NUJS Vice-Chancellor, citing a delay in filing beyond the POSH Act's limitation period. While the court acknowledged the delayed complaint, it directed that the judgment be included in the Vice-Chancellor's resume. This unusual directive serves as a permanent record of the allegations, despite their dismissal on procedural grounds.

title: ‚ÄòThat wasn‚Äôt even a moment‚Äô: Fans slam NFL over Charlie Kirk tribute; sparks outrage
content: The NFL and Green Bay Packers honored Charlie Kirk with a moment of silence before facing the Washington Commanders. Fans called it rushed and poorly executed, slamming the league for inconsistency compared to past public statements. Kirk, 31, was killed Wednesday in Utah. The tribute came as Trump vowed to award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.

title: Utah tragedy: Patrick Mahomes silent after Kirk shooting; Randi, Tavia speak out
content: Following the tragic shooting death of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University, Patrick Mahomes has remained silent. Tavia Hunt, wife of the Chiefs owner, expressed grief and called for civility, a sentiment echoed by Patrick's mother, Randi Mahomes, who shared Tavia's post. The investigation into Kirk's death is ongoing, sparking renewed debate about violence.

title: Sanford International round: John Daly makes history; shocking 19 on 12th hole
content: Golf icon John Daly made unwanted history at the Sanford International, carding a shocking 19 on the par-5 12th hole. This score is now the highest ever recorded on a single hole in Champions Tour history. Daly's troubles began with a wayward tee shot, and lead to seven penalty drops.

title: Corey Perry sidelined after knee surgery, out 6-8 weeks for Los Angeles Kings
content: Veteran forward Corey Perry's debut with the Los Angeles Kings is delayed due to a knee injury sustained during training. The 40-year-old, signed in July, will be sidelined for 6-8 weeks, potentially missing October, including the home opener against Colorado. The Kings remain optimistic about Perry's return, valuing his experience and scoring ability for a deep playoff run.

title: Davis Cup: Epic! India defeat Switzerland for a rare milestone since 1993
content: India have made it to the Davis Cup Qualifiers. Sumit Nagal's win over Henry Bernet sealed the victory against Switzerland. This is India's first away win against a European team since 1993. Nagal's return to the Davis Cup proved crucial. Earlier, N Sriram Balaji and Rithvik Bollipalli lost the doubles match. The Davis Cup Qualifiers are scheduled for January 2026.

title: India vs Pakistan: Zayed Khan backs Team India ahead of Asia Cup 2025 clash
content: Bollywood actor Zayed Khan has come out in full support of Team India before their high-voltage Asia Cup 2025 clash against Pakistan. Confident about the Men in Blue‚Äôs form, Zayed declared that India will dominate the tournament, calling them a ‚Äúdamn good team.‚Äù

title: New study warns fish oil supplements linked to heart disease; raises high risks
content: Recent research from the British Heart Foundation suggests regular fish oil supplements may slightly elevate stroke and atrial fibrillation risk in healthy individuals. Conversely, those with existing heart conditions might experience reduced heart attack risk and improved survival. Experts recommend obtaining omega-3s through diet, emphasizing oily fish, nuts, and seeds.

title: ‚Äò50‚Äì100% tariff‚Äô: Trump threatens China; presses Nato to unite on Russia sanctions
content: Donald Trump has proposed significant tariffs on Chinese goods and urged NATO allies to cease oil purchases from Russia to swiftly end the war in Ukraine. He criticized NATO's commitment and blamed Biden and Zelenskyy for prolonging the conflict.

title: Are you experiencing 'tall poppy syndrome'? Subtle workplace signs to notice
content: Tall Poppy Syndrome, prevalent globally but originating in Australia and New Zealand, describes the phenomenon of high achievers being subtly undermined in workplaces. A study reveals this affects women disproportionately, impacting confidence and mental health. This manifests as exclusion, downplaying ambition, and reluctance to showcase creative work, hindering both individual growth and organizational innovation.

title: China gold licences: Yellow metal‚Äôs largest buyer to ease rules; diversify from dollar
content: China is easing gold import/export licensing, aiming to diversify reserves from the US dollar. The People's Bank of China (PBOC) plans to broaden the use of faster ‚Äúmulti-use permits‚Äù by increasing authorized ports and extending permit validity. This builds on a 2016 initiative to streamline gold trade.

title: Politics heats up over India-Pak match: Oppn corners govt, BJP cites 'compulsion'
content: The upcoming India-Pakistan Asia Cup clash ignites political controversy. Shiv Sena (UBT) and Congress leaders criticize the match as immoral and profit-driven, citing past grievances and questioning the government's stance. BJP leaders, however, rally behind the Indian team, framing it as a matter of national pride. Maharashtra leaders exchange barbs, highlighting the deep divisions surrounding the event.

title: IND vs PAK boycott: Ex-cricketer and BJP leader reiterates - ‚ÄòShouldn‚Äôt be played‚Äô
content: Following the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, calls to boycott India's Asia Cup clash with Pakistan intensify. Kedar Jadhav reiterates his stance against the match, echoing strong public sentiment. While the Indian team acknowledges the sensitivity, they remain focused on cricket, guided by government and BCCI instructions, as emphasized by fielding coach Ryan ten Doeschate.

title: News: Tigers' Tarik Skubal exits start early with tightness in side
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . the first of six matinees is at Wrigley Field with the Chicago Cubs hosting the Tampa Bay Rays . ace Tarik Skubal leaves in the fourth inning with an apparent injury .

title: How Terence Crawford landed Canelo Alvarez
content: canelo alvarez vs. 168-pound champion terence Crawford is on the cusp of his 37th birthday . he was addressing an audience of one: his patron, the Saudi Arabian boxing financier, Turki Alalshikh . both history and common sense favor not merely the naturally bigger man, but the younger one, and the so-called "A side"

title: After season of adversity, can Liberty put together another title run?
